item.title: Remote sensing 1.1: python -> Webhooks -> Google Sheet
item.description: Toward my goal for remote sensing of my yard soil, I would like to divide its porject into several modules. module 1. Combining 1 and 2 Setting up module 1 Since my Rasppberry pi 3 model 3 runs under Python, I would like to use Python in my computer to send some data to Google Sheet.

item.title: Useful R techniques 4: Pretty Heatmap
item.description: SUMMARY pheatmap() is useful for easy and pretty heatmap Demonstration of example() and demo() function How to reorder columns? How to add annotation bar with custom colors. example(pheatmap) ## ## phetmp> # Create test matrix ## phetmp> test = matrix(rnorm(200), 20, 10) ## ## phetmp> test[1:10, seq(1, 10, 2)] = test[1:10, seq(1, 10, 2)] + 3 ## ## phetmp> test[11:20, seq(2, 10, 2)] = test[11:20, seq(2, 10, 2)] + 2 ## ## phetmp> test[15:20, seq(2, 10, 2)] = test[15:20, seq(2, 10, 2)] + 4 ## ## phetmp> colnames(test) = paste("Test", 1:10, sep = "") ## ## phetmp> rownames(test) = paste("Gene", 1:20, sep = "") ## ## phetmp> # Draw heatmaps ## phetmp> pheatmap(test) ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, kmeans_k = 2) ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, scale = "row", clustering_distance_rows = "correlation") ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, color = colorRampPalette(c("navy", "white", "firebrick3"))(50)) ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, cluster_row = FALSE) ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, legend = FALSE) ## ## phetmp> # Show text within cells ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, display_numbers = TRUE) ## ## phetmp> pheatmap(test, display_numbers = TRUE, number_format = "%.

item.title: Heart rate data analysis 1
item.description: An Apple watch measures heart rate and you can download its raw data. Here I plotted my daughter’s data in this year. item.title: Slide presentation in R with xarigan package
item.description: How to make slides in RStudio As an audience of a seminar, it is difficut to follow presentation when screen is scrolling down that happens in regular websites. Esay convertion from RMarkdown to slides are described in Rmarkdown book. To make slides for presentation of your RMarkdown documents, xarigan package developed by Yihui Xie is a powerful tool. Please find a demo presentation. Alternative method is using Rpresentation or isoslides (see details in the Rmarkdown book).
